result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam P Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>50g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances
.

Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed necessary by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

Def in court w/ Atty Eric Steven Sanford.  Def in custody.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
SANFORD: we will ask for a con't . HYNEK: no objectino to a con't. SANFORD: we did discuss what I did and didn't have well before yesterday. DEF: I don't object to a con't even tho I might remain in custody. SANFORD: I think a few mos will be sufficient. The other thing I was anticipating a more extensive witness list than the 6 listed and if there's only those we might be done in 2 days. I anticipate one plus the def is he chooses to testify.
